doc:
Louise Huntington https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Louise_Huntington 0 Louise Huntington (November 1, 1904, Dallas, Texas – June 2, 1997, Summit, New Jersey) was a stage and screen actress appearing on Broadway in the 1920s and on screen in the 1930s. Her film career included silent movies as well as some of the first sound productions. The Viking, in which she appeared in 1931, was the first Canadian-produced film to include sound. Huntington's stage career took her overseas and she is reported to be the first American woman to perform in South Africa. Later in life Huntington continued performing on stage and on television. She also directed theater and continued to act in commercials into her 80's. She was married to Robert Roberts, whom she later divorced. Her second husband was Sydney Houston who died in the mid-1970s. She died in Summit, New Jersey in 1997. Louise_Huntington ( November_1_,_1904 , Dallas , Texas – June_2_,_1997 , Summit , New_Jersey ) was a_stage_and_screen_actress appearing on Broadway in the_1920s and on screen in the_1930s . Her_film_career included silent_movies as_well_as some of the_first_sound_productions . The_Viking_, in which she appeared in 1931 , was the_first_Canadian-produced_film to_include sound . Huntington 's_stage_career took her_overseas and she is_reported_to_be the_first_American_woman to_perform in South_Africa . Later in life_Huntington continued_performing on stage and on television . She also directed theater and continued_to_act in commercials into her_80 's . She was_married to Robert_Roberts , whom she later divorced . Her_second_husband was Sydney_Houston who died in the_mid-1970s . She died in Summit , New_Jersey in 1997 .
